basics.name: Junseok Park
basics.label: Research Fellow
basics.summary: A computational scientist, data scientist, or bioinformatician with expertise in computer science, skilled in developing machine learning models, designing large-scale data processing pipelines, and performing statistical analyses of next-generation sequencing and multi-omic experiments from patient cohortsâ€”ranging from single-cell to DNA and RNA sequence samples.

work.name: Boston Children's Hospital and Harvard Medical School
work.position: Research Fellow (PI: Dr. Alice Eunjung Lee)
work.summary: Conducting statistical genetics research and biostatistics techniques to support research hypotheses derived from high-throughput DNA, RNA, and single-cell sequencing data.
highlights: Developed a tool rTea to detect transposon-fusions, analyzing 13,345 RNA-seq from normal and 34 cancer types. Identified 307,793 cancer-specific fusions with ~30 events per cancer.
Employed a Generalized Linear Mixed Model to correct for six technical variables in RNA-seq data from 28 human tissue types, identifying 48% of fusions (avg 639 per sample) in testis.
Developed GenomeFlow to process large datasets on GCP, achieving a 77% cost reduction (saving $86K) in its first application compared to the initial setup.
Adopted Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) to detect somatic L1 insertions, achieving 0.885 precision and 0.845 recall from bulk WGS of a cancer cell line.
Used SVM to validate the RF model for utilizing zebrafish as a model of Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy, showing similar outcomes (AUROC = 0.99) to the RF model.
Customized the DRAGEN-GATK pipeline on GCP to ensure variant quality from WGS samples, supporting the identification of ATM gene mutations in six ataxia-telangiectasia cases.

work.name: KAIST - Bio-Synergy Research Center(BSRC)
work.summary: Developed computational frameworks for biomedical research, improving data reliability, clinical trial retrieval, biomedical term similarity, and drug-disease network analysis.
highlights: Developed CORUS on AWS to collect participatory trial data and verified the data reliability weight index using an independent samples t-test (p < 0.011) with data from 340 participants.
Built a clinical trial protocol database system CLIPS from 184,634 trials, achieving a 35% higher F1-score (0.52) and 82% greater user satisfaction (6.5) than keyword search (2.3).
Developed a Doc2Vec model with 998,543 definitions from UMLS2015 and Wikipedia, improving biomedical term similarity by 35% and coverage by 4.77% over the Vector method.
Supported the identification of drugs with opposing effects on disease genes by combining 2,434 drug-target interactions, 166 pathways, and 364 disease genes for network analysis.

work.name: Korea Research Institute of Chemical Technology (KRICT)
work.summary: Collaborated in a team to develop a chemical reagent management system, enhancing laboratory efficiency.
highlights: Leveraged Oracle DB, HTML5, and JavaScript engines for system development.

work.name: Seoul National University Hospital
work.summary: Integrated EMR/EHR/PHR to streamline medical record management and develop a hospital management system.

work.name: Korea BIO-IT Foundry Gwang-ju Centre
work.summary: Designed and developed a high-speed additive reagent injection and inspection system.
highlights: Utilized a Support Vector Machine algorithm to enhance precision in biotech systems.

work.name: SKTelecom
work.summary: Optimized and enhanced the performance of WCDMA networks, benefiting 12 million customers.
highlights: Developed customized C++ program blocks for the Mobile Switching Center and Software Data Network.

work.name: Republic of Korea Army -- 31 Division
work.summary: Developed ocean protection radar systems along the Korean coast to enhance coastal surveillance and maritime safety.
highlights: Utilized Visual C++ 6.0 to design systems for recording and analyzing critical data.

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

courses: Deep Learning and Dynamic Neural Network Models

education.institution: Chonnam National University, Gwangju, South Korea

awards.title: NEBS-Tomocube Award Presentation
awards.summary: Award presented by NEBS and Tomocube.

awards.title: Basic Science Research Funding
awards.awarder: National Research Fund, Republic of Korea
awards.summary: Funding for an extraordinary Research Fellow conducting research outside South Korea in the field of artificial intelligence applied to genetics and genomics, as well as basic science research, was provided by the National Research Fund, Republic of Korea (135 million KRW).

awards.title: AnVIL Cloud Credits Continued Program
awards.awarder: National Human Genome Research Institute, USA
awards.summary: Cloud program fund for genomic research supported by the National Human Genome Research Institute.

awards.title: Korean Government Scholarship, Ph.D.
awards.summary: Scholarship for Ph.D. studies funded by the Korean Government at KAIST.

awards.title: KIA Scholarship
awards.summary: A scholarship awarded by the KAIST KIA Fund to students with high academic achievement and excellent research performance.

awards.title: ICC Scholarship
awards.summary: A scholarship awarded by the KAIST ICC Fund to students with high academic achievement and excellent research performance.
